intro: Triplarina nowraensis, commonly known as the Nowra triplarina, is a flowering plant native to New South Wales, Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that appear in clusters, typically during the spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a glossy surface. Triplarina nowraensis is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to the dry, temperate climate of its native region.
